Job_title: Lead Business Analyst – Science and Technology
Description:
Abingdon, Ashby-de-la-Zouch, Stevenage, Warrington

 As a Lead Business Analyst at Tessella you will enjoy a varied, challenging and rewarding role. You will be working with our customers and lead internal project teams to help solve complex scientific and engineering problems, fulfil needs and exceed expectations.
 

 The Role
 

 
Our projects range from complex computing and analytical challenges through to technical consultancy, modelling and simulation. You will work across many domains in different scientific and technical areas and be keen to expand your experience into new areas of expertise. You should be committed to delivering high quality solutions which will add real value to our clients’ businesses.
 

 
The role will involve a reasonable amount of travel to meet with customers, so we are happy to consider candidates who wish to be based any of our UK offices.
 

 
Responsibilities
 

 Apply your strong analytical skills to thoroughly understand our customers’ business and IT needs, translate and capture requirement specifications using common templates using natural language.
 Elicit technical, functional and non-functional requirements using document analysis, workflow analysis, business process descriptions, scenarios and use cases via interviews, customer site visits and requirement workshops.
 Analyse and evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, deconvolute and decompose higher level information into focused detail. Abstract lower-level technical detail to enable a general understanding of the information and problem at hand.
 Drive and challenge our customers on their assumptions as to how they can successfully execute their plans and work with them to identify and differentiate true underlying business needs from user requests.
 Act as a conduit between business and customer representatives and the software development teams. Ensure that all requirements and needs are communicated accurately and effectively and are well understood.
 Represent the end users in ensuring solution compliance by helping draft test plans and scripts and carrying out high-level integration and acceptance testing.
 Support Tessella sales managers with generating proposals for tender and winning new business for the company.
 Requirements
 

 A scientific or numerate BSc, MSc or PhD.
 Professional experience in a science or engineering domain, ideally life sciences. Experience purely in Finance is NOT particularly relevant to this role.
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
 The ability to work and interact with diverse groups of people across varied problem domains.
 The ability to engage in and manage multiple activities simultaneously.
 A good understanding of current business analysis best practices and be able to leverage benefit from their application to new problems.
 Experience in analytics, energy, public sector or consumer goods domains would be an advantage.
 BCS/ISEB or CBAP qualification is desirable but not essential.
 Software development experience would be useful.
 

 About Tessella
 

 
Tessella is a world leading consultancy, with a first-class reputation as innovators at the intersection of advanced science and novel technology. Our unique fusion of applied math, scientific computing, AI, and engineering delivers ground-breaking, multi-disciplinary solutions for our R&D-driven clients tackling humanity’s generational challenges.
 

 
Our work is highly varied and rewarding, blending next generation technology at the cutting-edge of applied R&D, building data-driven solutions to complex real-world problems. From applying the latest techniques to overcome the computational challenges of identifying new vaccines or cancer treatments, to making manufacturing more sustainable or harnessing green energy, our work makes a difference to people’s lives. At Tessella we write the software and build the models that deliver everything from the fast, accurate prediction of the spread of disease to the intelligent automation needed to make the future of transport safer and energy efficient, or control systems to guide spacecraft on missions to enhance our understanding of the universe.
 

 
Tessella is part of Capgemini Engineering. Capgemini is a multicultural company of over 270,000 team members in almost 50 countries.

Site Name:
  UK - Hertfordshire - Stevenage, USA - Pennsylvania - Upper Providence
 

 Posted Date:
  Sep 28 2021
 
Our team collaborates with top laboratory and clinical scientists to advance exciting, innovative ideas in drug discovery. We design experiments, analyze data, and visualize results for projects that range from small studies with single endpoints to high-dimensional genomic data. We use traditional statistical methods and modern machine learning algorithms, design experiments to develop new technologies and analyze data to identify biomarkers for clinical trials. Our work is varied and challenging with the common goal to advance the science of human health.
 
To succeed, team members need good technical and communication skills, the desire to develop their statistical and scientific knowledge continually, and the ability to develop practical solutions and apply statistical techniques in creative ways. Successful candidates will be innovative, pragmatic, and flexible, thriving in a dynamic, collegial environment with frequent new challenges and excellent opportunities to develop and succeed.
 
In this role, the Statistics Leader / Director will be responsible for providing statistical consulting for 1-2 scientific research areas within GSK.
 
Key Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
 
Collaborating closely with GSK scientists and scientific management to address important drug discovery questions with statistical methods
 
Identifying key scientific challenges that can be addressed with statistical methods and proposing how to do so
 
Applying existing statistical methods or developing new ones to address scientific problems
 
Designing experiments and ensuring experiments are designed to address scientific questions clearly and accurately
 
Analyzing data and ensuring the results of statistical analyses can be relied upon for making important drug discovery decisions around targets, molecules, and technologies
 
Communicating statistical concepts, design recommendations, and the results of statistical analyses clearly and accurately to GSK scientists and research managers at all levels
 
Supervising a small team (2-5 people) of statisticians, enhancing their ability to address key scientific questions by providing technical (statistical and scientific) direction to projects and by developing their consulting skills
 
Identifying and contributing statistics methodological expertise within the team through ongoing personal development and collaboration on challenging technical problems
 
GSK’s overall R&D strategy focuses on science related to the immune system, the use of human genetics and advanced technologies. These unlock the potential of new areas of science, enabling us to design and develop new classes of medicine and bring them to patients more quickly and cost-effectively.
 
Applications close once position is filled.

Job_title: Quantum Algorithms and Machine Learning Scientist
Description:
Cambridge Quantum (CQ) is a global leader in software and enterprise applications that help its partners, collaborators, and clients to work effortlessly across multiple platforms and solve some of the most intriguing problems in their industry through quantum computing. Our focus is in the areas of quantum chemistry, quantum machine learning, and quantum encryption.
 *
 Quantum Algorithms and Machine Learning at Cambridge Quantum*
 The quantum computers available today have proven to be a viable tool to investigate scientific, engineering, and industrial problems. Yet, the full potential of quantum computation has not been unlocked. In fact, hardware limitations typical of the Noisy Intermediate-Scale (NISQ) era, such as noise, a small number of qubits, and inefficient Input/Output operations have hindered the implementation of well known, powerful algorithms. On one hand, Variational Quantum Algorithms_ (VQAs)_ can circumvent NISQ obstacles but closer scientific scrutiny is necessary to understand the trade off between robustness and efficiency. On the other hand, quantum algorithms that have quantum advantage guarantees and are suitable for NISQ devices are mostly unexplored territory.
 At CQ we have studied machine learning (ML) problems and used parameterized quantum circuits as quantum models for supervised learning, generative modelling, and Bayesian inference. CQ scientists have explored the reach of VQAs beyond ML, to attack nonlinear partial differential equations, combinatorial optimization, quantum simulation and Monte Carlo sampling. Whilst VQAs have proven to be practical and flexible tools for current NISQ computers, we believe that developing algorithms that go beyond variational approaches is crucial. We are committed to researching ways of bringing the advantage guarantees of algorithms for fault-tolerant quantum computers to NISQ hardware more systematically, which is a key goal for the whole quantum computing sector in the medium term.
 *
 Role description*
 Cambridge Quantum is looking to expand its cutting edge Machine Learning and Quantum Algorithms division with a full-time researcher. The successful candidate will join a world-class scientific team focused on quantum algorithms for machine learning, and other key computational problems, with a particular focus on variational and differentiable approaches. The new member of the team will participate in ongoing research projects, but is expected to pioneer new research directions in quantum algorithms and address some of the more compelling open questions.
 The research will be both theoretical and aimed at benchmarking new algorithms on the state of the art of quantum computers. Significant results will be published in peer-reviewed journals and/or patented. Aside from the pure research focus, this role will support client engagements by contributing to the definition of the scientific scope, the problem formulation, and the solution using quantum algorithms.
 The candidate must have
 PhD in Quantum Physics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or related field
 Knowledge of research topics in quantum information, quantum algorithms and machine learning
 Published research in at least one of the aforementioned topics
 Desirable Skills
 Peer-reviewed publications on high impact factor journals
 Familiarity with NISQ device and their implementation aspects
 What is in it for you?
 Working alongside a highly talented team, with leading names in the quantum computing industry. We offer a highly competitive package including equity participation, 28 day’s paid annual leave, a workplace pension and a positive approach to flexible working.
 *
 About Us: *
 Founded in 2014, CQ operates at the very core of quantum computing and is backed by some of the world’s leading partners with strong domain expertise including IBM, Honeywell and JSR Corp. Our core focus is in quantum software and enterprise applications in the area of quantum chemistry, quantum machine learning, and quantum encryption. With over 150 professionals, CQ has a strong and unique scientific grounding in terms of its core team with over 100 scientists, of which over 70 are Ph.D. holders. CQ has a “Science Led; Enterprise Driven” approach and built a tier one ecosystem of customers, investors, and partners including IBM, Honeywell, JSR Corp, Total, Nippon Steel, and many other Fortune 500 companies. We are in the process of expanding our operations significantly across our offices in Cambridge (U.K.), Oxford, London, Washington, DC, and Tokyo.
 In June 2021, CQ announced a merger with Honeywell Quantum Solutions (HQS), a Honeywell business unit and maker of the highest performing quantum computer currently available. Honeywell has been an investor in and commercial partner with Cambridge Quantum since 2019. The deal is intended to close in Q4 this calendar year and is subject to the satisfaction of certain regulatory approvals, and other customary closing conditions.
 Please note that employment at CQ is subject to successfully passing our pre-employment screening checks.
 CQ is an inclusive equal opportunity employer
 Job Type: Full-time
 Work Location: Multiple Locations

About RGS
 

 
Richmond Global Sciences (RGS) is a leading technology company creating tools to help investors allocate capital sustainably. We are motivated by the potential that technology and data can exponentially improve investors’ decision-making regarding Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) issues. Our team is composed of experts in sustainability and ESG investing with technology leaders in the world of AI and machine learning.
 

 
RGS is an early-stage startup with a small, dynamic team. We are passionate about our mission to create a more sustainable and inclusive economy. We strongly believe that everyone has the right to know the real impact of their decisions on the planet and people. If we are successful, people will have the information needed to enable positive progress.
 

 
Equal Opportunity Employer
 
RGS is committed to equity and fairness in all aspects of its operations. RGS does not discriminate against any individual based on gender, race, ethnicity, place of origin, religion, political affiliation, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or physical disability.
 

 
Who are we looking for?
 

 
We are looking for a quantitative ESG Researcher with a passion for social impact and sustainability issues to join our ESG research team. The successful applicant will combine exceptional analytical and quantitative skills and work at the heart of our operations, developing and improving our methodology as well as building predictive models to improve our data offerings. S/he will demonstrate an exceptional academic record and deep experience in economic and statistical modelling. The individual will be expected to thrive in an entrepreneurial environment and thus demonstrate ambition, excellent teamwork skills and the ability to manage multiple responsibilities.
 

 
The role will provide a deep understanding of the environmental and social impacts of large corporations and their relevance for investors. It is also an opportunity to be part of the early stages of product development at a fast-growing SaaS startup.
 

 
Responsibilities:
 

 Continuously improve how we think and model ESG impact risks and opportunities and how we develop solutions for investors
 Check and validate impact calculations and assumptions
 Build predictive models to improve our data offering
 Check and validate impact calculations
 Deliver relevant, actionable insights on companies to investors. Become a trusted go-to expert on core ESG topics
 Identify, map, and analyze relevant datasets to enhance the impact calculations
 Prepare reports and presentations of document findings
 Support the overall mission, vision, and goals of Richmond Global Sciences
 Skills and Requirements:
 

 Advanced degree in economics, mathematics, finance, physics, statistics, or another quantitative field. PhD is highly desirable
 Passionate about social impact and sustainability issues and the use of data to solve them
 Proven economic and statistical modelling skills
 Strong coding skills, preferable in Python or R
 Exceptional analytical and quantitative problem-solving skills. Ability to interpret data, theorize, and make decisions based on data
 Experience relating to social and environmental impact methodologies, whether with a data provider, asset manager, or within academia
 Experience guiding team members to implement technical methodology developments
 Ability to communicate data insights to a non-analytical audience
 Self-starter who will excel in a start-up environment by taking ownership and initiative
 Applicants need to be eligible to work in the UK
 What are we offering?
 

 Competitive salary (based on experience)
 A supportive team and working environment that values excellence and is motivated by making a positive impact on society and the environment
 An opportunity to gain in-depth knowledge of ESG frameworks and the environmental and social impacts of specific sub-industries
 An invaluable insight into the early stages of product development at a fast-growing SaaS startup
 No corporate overhead, endless meetings, arbitrary goals, and pointless reviews
 How to apply:
 

 
Please send a CV and a cover letter explaining why you are interested and suitable for this role to: careers@rgsciences.com with the subject line “Quantitative ESG Researcher Application”.

Your Role

Analysts act to support and develop the economic and other modelling capabilities on which the chemical industry expertise and insight offered by IHS Markit to clients is built. Senior Bioinformatician

 

 About Achilles:
 
Achilles is a fast paced, trail blazing company. We are breaking new ground with our science creating products that have never been made. As no-one has done what we are doing before, there is no playbook to copy. This means we must innovate, adapt and collaborate across our organisation, working together to solve novel problems. This entrepreneurial spirit and approach runs through our company and those who thrive here are able to cope with anything that is thrown at them, enjoy ambiguity and thrive on making things happen even when there is not a detailed brief.

 

 Role Summary:
 
We are seeking a talented and enthusiastic Senior Bioinformatician (Algorithmic Development) to join a newly established Algorithms and Predictive Modelling team within Bioinformatics Research. Our PELEUS platform automatically identifies a cancer patient’s individual clonal neoantigens from DNA/RNA sequencing data derived from their tumour. This enables Achilles to manufacture a personalised T cell therapy for each patient targeting their clonal neoantigens. This new team will be responsible for developing tools to automate decision making by extracting information from noisy biological signals. This team will collaborate closely with other bioinformatics scientists, as well as biologists, clinicians and manufacturing scientists from the wider company.

 
This is a unique opportunity to join a company in an exciting start-up phase that has the ability to transform the clinical management of cancer.

 

 Responsibilities:
 

 Develop a deep understanding of how the PELEUS platform is used in Achilles
 Translate stakeholder needs into precise and testable functional requirements for new algorithm components
 Using an agile approach and a strong bias towards principalled statistical methods, develop bespoke algorithms for tasks associated with identification of patient specific clonal neoantigens where “off the shelf” bioinformatics tools do not meet our functional and business requirements
 Plan and then execute experiments to characterise algorithm performance, exploring average case and edge case behaviour. Identify and implement any corresponding failsafe measures. This may involve design, selection or development of various test data sets (i.e. simulated data, cell line data, patient data)
 To record all experiments in an accurate, timely and clearly presented manner, and use this to prepare data summaries and reports as and when required
 Produce thorough but concise written documentation of algorithms, including mathematical descriptions of models and their assumptions, produce standard operating procedures, and contribute to intellectual property submissions
 Work closely with the Bioinformatics Software development team to derisk the transfer of newly developed tools into production, supporting integration and testing activities
 Effectively communicate analyses and research findings to a technical and non-technical audience
 

 Requirements:
 

 Qualifications, experience, knowledge:
 PhD or MSc in a highly quantitative subject such as statistics, bioinformatics, computational biology, machine learning, physics or signal processing
 Minimum 2+ (PhD) or 5+ (MSc) years experience working in machine learning, statistics, bioinformatics, computational biology, or equivalent
 Experience with applied statistical modelling, ideally gained from next generation sequencing data applications
 Experience with method/algorithmic development
 Extensive knowledge of cancer genomics (desirable)
 Evidence of independence and original contributions to research (desirable)
 Skills and abilities
 Demonstrated fluency in R and/or Python
 Extensive knowledge of UNIX based operating systems
 Experience with HPC environments
 Functional knowledge of distributed version control systems (e.g. git)
 Experience working with multi-omic (Exomes, Whole Genomes, RNAseq, TCR-seq, Single Cell) next generation sequencing data (desirable)
 Previous experience of collaboration with clinicians and wetlab scientists (desirable)
 Previous experience with designing and running bioinformatics pipelines (desirable)
 Personal Attributes
 Strong team player
 Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
 Demonstrable excellence in problem solving within fixed timelines
 Good inter-personal skills with an ability to liaise effectively with other members of the group
 Flexibility and the ability to effectively manage multiple concurrent projects
 Excellent attention to detail
 Commitment to high quality research
 

 Benefits:
 
This is a permanent position, based in London offering a competitive benefits package

 XAI.bio aspires to create the future of drug discovery and development. We’re looking to recruit a Quantitative Biologist who will help build our technology platform to engineer medicines. Working in an interdisciplinary team of scientists and engineers, you will take the lead in developing groundbreaking modelling algorithms and tools.
 You have the amazing opportunity to become an integral part of our foundational team and influence the Company’s development. Competitive salary and benefits apply. Salary: £40,000 to £50,000 pa, depending on skills and experience. To apply, please submit your CV and cover letter. The deadline for applications is Friday 25 June 2021.
 Minimum Qualifications

 Experience in developing software pipelines, applications, or packages/libraries for modelling and analysing biology
 Experience in general-purpose programming and scripting languages: Python, Java, R, C/C++, Julia
 Familiarity with building knowledge graphs
 Experienced with theory, principles, and statistical aspects of mechanistic mathematical modelling and simulations; familiar with a broad range of areas, for example, quantitative structure-activity relationships (QSAR) modelling, ODE modelling, PKPD modelling, quantitative systems-level modelling (QSP/QST), statistical genomics.
 Preferred Qualifications

 Self-directed, independent, and highly motivated, able to learn new concepts quickly, comfortable in a fast-paced environment

 XAI.bio is a deep tech therapeutics discovery and development startup. Incubated at Oxford University Innovation and based in Oxford, XAI.bio is expanding the frontiers of AI, biology and therapeutics.

job description:
 

 As we grow our Group Data team we are now actively hiring for another data engineer to join a key business area within Hiscox.
 
You'll be working in a team of 3 BI Specialists with a mix of analytics platform and data engineering skills, within a larger Group Data Engineering Team. We are all working towards the same goal, bringing the best support to the business by offering best practice counsel, quality consultancy.
 
The Role
 
We are looking for an expert in business intelligence, data engineering, data analysis or data visualisation to develop and deliver analytics solutions.
 
You’ll collaborate with business stakeholders and fellow technical resources to translate business problems into data driven solutions.
 
You'll have the opportunity to self-govern your own projects end-to-end and put your ideas and skills in to motion.
 
You’ll have the opportunity to be a part of a dynamic and rapidly expanding data community with access to leading technologies . This could provide you with new and exciting future opportunities within Hiscox.
 
What you'll be doing as an Data Specialist:
 
Acting as an internal consultant owning the design, build and delivery of impactful and insightful dashboards, visualisations and reports
 
Engineering datasets for use in analysis
 
Proactively engaging project stakeholders to elicit requirements
 
Promoting the use of analytics best practice across the group
 
Documenting of key activities and processes
 
General administration, security and maintenance
 
Provide general BAU support to the business including training, mentoring
 
Must have skills:
 
Significant experience in a business intelligence, data engineering, data analysis or data visualisation role
 
Significant expertise with a modern analytics/BI platforms like Tableau/ Power BI /Qlik
 
Significant expertise using data preparation tools like Alteryx Designer and SSIS
 
High level of ability in T- SQL
 
Strong understanding of data visualisation best practice
 
Strong understanding of data modelling best practices
 
Ability to translate business problems into data driven solutions
 
Confident communicator with both technical and non-technical audiences
 
A driven individual and effective team player
 
Work well under pressure and time constraints
 
Experience working in an Agile environment
 
Our nice to have skills:
 
Analytics vendor certification
 
Insurance industry experience
 
Degree in Science, Computer Science, Mathematics or similar quantitative discipline
 
At Hiscox we care about our people. We hire the best people for the job and we’re committed to diversity and creating a truly inclusive culture, which we believe drives success. We have also learned over the past 15 months that working life doesn’t always have to be in the office, and when it’s safe to do so, we will be introducing hybrid ways of working to encourage a healthy work life balance.
 
We anticipate the successful candidate for this role will be in the office 3 days every 3 weeks to fit with our larger Group Data Engineering team
 
We see it as the best of both worlds: structure and sociability on one hand, and independence and flexibility on the other.

Job_title: Machine Learning Scientist- Alexa, TTS Voices & Languages
Description:
MSc degree in CS, Machine Learning or related area with 3 years of applied research experience
 Comprehensive and deep knowledge in fields such as Machine Learning, Deep Learning, TTS, ASR, NLU or Statistical modeling with at least one publication, as first author, in a leading conference or journal related to one of these fields
 Computer Science fundamentals in algorithm design, complexity analysis, data structures, problem solving and diagnosis
 Proficiency in at least one modern programming language (Java, C/C++, C#)
 Proficiency in at least one scripting language (Python, Ruby, Perl)
 Experience with Linux/Unix systems and Bash scripting
 Professional communication skills and ability to contribute to team discussions
 Working proficiency in English
 
Job summary

 Do you want to work on some of the most innovative Text-to-Speech technology in the industry? Well, you’ve come to the right place.

 
We are looking for a passionate, talented, and inventive Applied Scientist with a strong background in Machine/Deep Learning and Software Development to help build industry-leading Speech and Language technology. Our mission is to push the envelope in Text-to-Speech (TTS) in order to provide the best-possible experience for our customers. Your role is to leverage your strong background in Computer Science and Machine Learning to help build the next generation of our synthetic voices used by millions of customers every day.

 
Key job responsibilities

 As an Applied Scientist on our team you will work with talented peers to develop novel algorithms and modeling techniques to advance the state of the art in speech synthesis. You will leverage Amazon’s heterogeneous data sources and large-scale computing resources to build Machine Learning models for their application in speech synthesis.

 This role requires a pragmatic technical leader comfortable with ambiguity, capable of summarizing complex data and models through clear visual and written explanations.

 
The ideal candidate will have experience with machine learning models and their application in AI systems. We are particularly interested in experience applying natural language processing, deep learning, and reinforcement learning at scale. Additionally, we are seeking candidates with strong interest in applied sciences and engineering, creativity, curiosity, and great judgment.

 
A day in the life

 No two days are the same as a Applied Scientist in TTS Voices and Languages!

 
You will be working in a dynamic, fast-moving environment, and operate at several different levels: one minute you’ll be applying the latest and greatest techniques in Deep Learning and Digital Signal Processing to improve the quality of our speech models, the next you will be running experiments and writing papers and patents or making prototype solutions production ready.

 
About the team

 This role sits with TTS, and the goal of the team is to create natural, friendly and emotional voices for Alexa.

 

 PhD with specialization in text-to-speech, natural language processing, or machine learning
 Extensive hands-on experience in deep learning and speech synthesis
 Working knowledge of an object-oriented language like Java, C/C++, Python
 Strong knowledge of data structures, algorithms, OS and distributed systems
 Experience with end-to-end agile software development
 Ability to communicate complex technical concepts and solutions to all levels of the organization
 Strong publication record
 A track record of thought leadership and contributions that have advanced the field
 
To learn more about the Digital Products team at Amazon,visit http://www.amazon.com/careers/digitalproducts and apply now.

 
Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

The Role:

The role provides an opportunity to work at the forefront of innovation in the field of sustainable finance. The successful candidate will help to shape S&P Global Sustainable1’s cutting-edge suite of ESG analytics by developing environmental assessment and quantification methodologies that are required to deliver this essential intelligence to our clients.

 A high-impact role, with responsibility for key inputs to S&P Global’s core ESG products & services.

 Work with a diverse international team, including senior stakeholders across S&P Global.
 As a high performing technical specialist, you will have access to S&P Global’s vast array of technical trainings, and the opportunity to develop your expertise in an expanding team with global reach.

 Intermediate or advanced technical skills in Microsoft Excel.

 Detail-orientated and numerically proficient, with a natural curiosity and an innovative approach to problem solving.

 Self-motivated, organized, positive with a “can do” attitude. Has experience in planning and executing work assignments to tight deadlines, working independently and as part of a diverse international team.

 Excellent verbal communication skills, including confidently presenting complex information to key stakeholders in ways that they can easily understand.

 Fluent written and spoken English (additional languages will be looked upon favorably).

 

 Preferred Experience:

 Bachelor’s/Master’s degree or equivalent in environmental science, sustainability or similar.

 Experience using ESG data collection software; and other data software packages, incl. Alteryx, Tableau, Power BI (or similar).

 Experience working with business sector classification systems.

Job_title: Head of Applied Science - Pricing Platform (w/d/m)
Description:
Machine learning, econometrics, data science and operations research drive our algorithmic pricing platform to recommend discounts for 500K+ articles in 20+ countries. Depending on expertise you will lead some of our science based delivery teams which incl. (1) deep learning based sales and demand forecasting at scale, (2) mixed integer programming based price optimization, (3) image mining based article matching for competitive pricing and (4) incrementality estimation via article based A/B testing and causal modeling.
 

 
Join us during an exciting time of growth and interesting long term strategic challenges ahead such as price recommendation for new markets and product categories, article level partner price competition, integration inventory and competitive pricing, holistic steering across premises and channels, incrementality measurement and CLV based steering.
 

 
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
 

 Define the long term strategy and guide research roadmaps for your teams. Align with business stakeholders, product management and engineering leaders.
 Guide team define, build and launch scalable scientific software solutions with high business impact.
 Attract and develop applied scientists and (optional) engineers. Sustain a research culture, scientific problem solving and solution delivery with strong ownership.
 Represent the pricing platform in Zalando's large science community and initiate cross unit collaboration. Manage our research collaboration with the Massachusetts Institute of Technology.
 

 WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR
 

 Masters or PhD degree in a quantitative field. Experience in end to end development and delivery of data driven products.
 10+ years of practical experience in two of the following domains: Machine Learning, Data Science, Forecasting, Deep Learning, Causal Inference, Algorithmic Pricing, Predictive Analytics
 5+ years of leadership experience leading applied science teams. Cross functional incl. engineers is a plus.
 Strong collaborator and communicator and ability to work with non-technical business stakeholders to translate business requirements into technology solutions.
 

 PERKS AT WORK
 

 Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs, product demos, parties & events
 Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
 Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
 Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations)
 

 We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.

Job_title: Senior Manager, Machine Learning Science - Recommender Systems
Description:
Are you up for your next challenge where you can lead the Recommendations data science team for Expedia Group? Would you like to work in the fast-paced, traveller focused and data-rich world of travel technology, and power travel for millions of people?
 
If you are passionate in using Data Science and ML to build data powered products, tackle ambitious problems and are seeking a high-profile role in which you’ll be able to directly impact millions of our customers and partners around the world, this could be the role for you!
 
Our team focuses on Personalisation and Recommendations across all Expedia Group brands such as Expedia.com, Hotels.com and Vrbo.
 
We help millions of travellers worldwide having a more personalized experience by creating Recommendations algorithms, including property, destinations, car and activity, to help our travellers finding their dream holiday more quickly. We’re also responsible for Traveler Intent prediction and Customer Experience AI.
 
This key role involves leading the Expedia Group Recommendations data science team. We build ML algorithms to solve high-impact, sophisticated problems using cutting-edge technology and approaches while working in a diverse team. You will also mentor the team and help ensure the timely delivery of key projects.
 
What you'll do:
 
Lead the team and manage the delivery of cutting edge recommendation algorithms;
 
Mentor and provide technical support to more junior members of the team;
 
Build, deploy and optimise ML models recommendations;
 
Work in close partnership with Product, Data and Technology teams to identify new opportunities and ensure that key projects that are carried out in the team are delivered;
 
Develop a deep understanding of our data and ML infrastructure and champion infrastructure development needs which will help the whole team work more effectively;
 
Be a technical leader on use, adoption and implementation of personalization and recommendations algorithms.
 
Who you are:
 
MSc or PhD degree in: ML or Computer Science, computer vision, mathematics, or a science field with strong data/ML component.
 
3+ years hands on experience with ML in production, building datasets, selecting and engineering features, building and optimizing algorithms.
 
Experience in several of the following domains: Recommender Systems, Deep Learning, Learn-to-Rank, Regression, Classification, Clustering.
 
Experience with ML packages such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, Python (scikit-learn, pandas, numpy, scipy, Matplotlib), Spark MLlib, etc.
 
Real world experience with Internet scale data on Spark, Hadoop or similar platform highly preferred.
 
Good data manipulation skills required including cleaning and managing data.
 
Good programming practices, ability to write readable, fast code.
 
Intellectual curiosity and desire to learn new things, techniques and technologies.
 
Nice to have:
 
Knowledge of test design, implementation and evaluation, with website A/B testing experience a plus.
 
Experience with data visualization tools and packages.
 
Why join us:
 
Expedia Group recognizes our success is dependent on the success of our people. We are the world's travel platform, made up of the most knowledgeable, passionate, and creative people in our business. Our brands recognize the power of travel to break down barriers and make people's lives better – that responsibility inspires us to be the place where exceptional people want to do their best work, and to provide them the tools to do so.
 
If you have a desire to make a difference with one of the most loved consumer brands in the world and the dynamic travel industry, this is the job for you.
 
Our family of travel brands includes: Brand Expedia®, Hotels.com®, Expedia® Partner Solutions, Egencia®, trivago®, VRBO®, Orbitz®, Travelocity®, Wotif®, lastminute.com.au®, ebookers®, CheapTickets®, Hotwire®, Classic Vacations®, Expedia® Media Solutions, CarRentals.com™, Expedia Local Expert®, Expedia® CruiseShipCenters®, SilverRail Technologies, Inc., ALICE and Traveldoo®.
 
Expedia is committed to creating an inclusive work environment with a diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, disability or age.
 
About Expedia Group

 Expedia Group (NASDAQ: EXPE) powers travel for everyone, everywhere through our global platform. Driven by the core belief that travel is a force for good, we help people experience the world in new ways and build lasting connections. We provide industry-leading technology solutions to fuel partner growth and success, while facilitating memorable experiences for travelers. Expedia Group's family of brands includes: Brand Expedia®, Hotels.com®, Expedia® Partner Solutions, Vrbo®, Egencia®, trivago®, Orbitz®, Travelocity®, Hotwire®, Wotif®, ebookers®, CheapTickets®, Expedia Group™ Media Solutions, Expedia Local Expert®, CarRentals.com™, and Expedia Cruises™.

Expedia is committed to creating an inclusive work environment with a diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, disability or age.

Location: 
 Newcastle upon Tyne, UK

 

 Type: 
 Permanent, office-based

 

 Salary: 
 On application, competitive and commensurate with experience

 

 

 About PHMR

 
Established in 2007, we are a highly successful and energetic consultancy –a diverse group of well-recognised

 
professional scientists, health economists, and industry specialists with a proven track record in providing

 
global market access solutions to some of the biggest healthcare industries so that patients get access to

 
medicines. Our science is internationally renowned, and we are proud of our work.
 

 We apply robust scientific approaches and methodologies. Quality science comes first

 We combine the expertise of our team with a worldwide professional network

 We continuously learn and improve

 90% of our projects are repeat or referral from our existing customers

 Most of our team are educated to PhD level

 We embrace diversity in all its forms
 

 
Our culture is open, team based, and inclusive. We are creative, innovative, and forward thinking, and we truly

 
operate as a team of people who enjoy spending time together. Our leadership team is always approachable

 
and offers coaching and training opportunities to the less experienced staff. PHMR also values and recognises

 
work-life balance, providing flexibility and individual support to all our team members. We love being part of

 
PHMR and perceive our culture to be vital to our success.

 

 

 Market Access Research Science at PHMR

 
The Market Access Research Science team has a diverse range of backgrounds, including clinical trial specialists,

 
laboratory scientists (from both academia and industry), teachers, and health economics and outcomes

 
researchers. We share the ability to analyse and present complex scientific information in an accessible way

 
and have excellent scientific communication skills.

 

 

 Purpose of the role

 
To obtain market access and reimbursement for their products, pharmaceutical companies must develop

 
comprehensive evidence packages that clearly demonstrate the value of the product. PHMR team of Market

 
Access Research Scientists works in collaboration with companies to ensure optimal reimbursement outcomes

 
by generating evidence and developing value communications in the field of health economics, including

 
disease burden, clinical trials, health-related quality of life and cost-effectiveness evaluations.

 
We develop a broad range of materials and are involved in all stages of the market access process, from data

 
identification and analysis to report writing and the development of slide decks.

 

 

 Success and growth factors:

 

 Functional technical expertise

 
As a Market Access Research Scientist at PHMR, you will have the opportunity to work on many different

 
projects and will be expected to support any of the following:

 Conducting and writing systematic and pragmatic literature reviews of:

 o Clinical trial data

 
o Impact of disease on patient health and quality of life

 
o Economic impact of disease

 
o Epidemiology

 Conducting reviews of Health Technology Assessments of existing drugs

 Medical writing, including preparation of manuscripts on a range of topics for publication in

 peer-reviewed journals

 Preparing materials to support product value, including value dossiers and value messages

 Production of proposals in response to client requests for proposals
 

 

 

 Success and growth factors (continued):

 

 Essential

 PhD in life sciences or MSc/BSc with 2 years of postgraduate experience

 Demonstrable interest in medical and/or scientific communication

 Excellent attention to detail and high standard of written work

  JO-2105-468592

 
Senior Bioinformatician – Proteomics

 

 Rate:
  Negotiable

 

 Job Type:
  Permanent

 

 Location:
  Oxford

 
Senior Bioinformatician Proteomics

 

 Senior Bioinformatician required by leading Biotech based in Oxford*
 
A leading Biotech, based in Oxford, currently requires a Senior Bioinformatician to work with Proteomics data and support the analysis and data management of mass-spectrometry based data.

 
Upon joining, the Senior Bioinformatician will join a team of 4 Bioinformaticians and will develop tools to assist the proteomics department with the analysis of large, complex data sets as well as working very closely with a team of 4 Software developers to develop a database system. The Bioinformatician will be the point of contact for all Proteomics data and will get involved in developing Machine Learning based solutions to uncover new insights.

 
In terms of skills, we are looking for Senior Bioinformaticians who have excellent experience with Python, AWS/Azure and some exposure to pipelining systems such as Nextflow/Luigi/Airflow or similar.

 
The Senior Bioinformatician will ideally have expertise within Proteomics and Mass Spectrometry and have an awareness of Machine Learning technology. On the education side, the Senior Bioinformatician must hold at least a MSc in Bioinformatics or similar.

 
This opportunity would suit a Bioinformatician who is looking to work in a rapidly growing Biotech who have an extremely interesting technology they are employing to discover new treatments and drugs. If youd like to learn more, please apply within!

About the Role

 DBRS Morningstar European Structured Finance team is looking for a financial industry professional at the level of Analyst. The role will be based in either London or Frankfurt as part of a pan-European research and analytics team and the analyst is expected to work closely with analysts in other European DBRS Morningstar offices. S/he should be willing to work in an environment with a strong focus on teamwork, have a strong worth ethic, an analytical mindset, and attention to detail.

 

 
The successful candidate will primarily work on European structured finance research and analytics projects. S/he will assist in the writing and production of Structured Finance published research, as well as be involved in various ongoing projects.

 

 
The successful candidate will possess the interpersonal, presentation, and communication skills necessary to work with professionals, executives, and external contacts. The analyst will take on the responsibility of providing data analysis, writing, and presenting research covering structured finance products and will report to the Head of Structured Finance Research. Strong writing skills will be needed to help support the production of thought leadership research. The role offers an opportunity to further develop structured finance research and analysis in a dynamic work environment.

 
Highly motivated candidates willing to learn, have a winning attitude, and who have the following skills will be paid particular attention: strong writing, analysis and presentation skills, and knowledge of securitisation.

 Job Responsibilities

 The individual’s main responsibilities will be to write thought leadership articles, analyse information, present findings, and engage with DBRS Morningstar sector rating analysts.

 

 Provide investor-focused commentaries, data, and information.

 Study, analyse and comment on performance trends for securitisation transactions: delinquencies, cumulative defaults, recoveries, prepayments, credit enhancement, and changes in collateral characteristics.

 Analyse and comment on topics related to structured finance, from lending to unemployment, rates to ratings

 Draft, review and/or finalise research for both internal and external use, such as discussion papers, press releases, presentations, and research commentaries.

 Qualifications

 Bachelor (or equivalent) degree in finance, financial engineering, mathematics, physics, economics, or similar quantitative discipline; Masters or CFA designation (enrolment or completion) is a plus.

 0-2 years of experience or more in an analytic role in structured finance or related areas at an advisory company, a bank, an investor, or at a credit rating agency.

 Excellent written and oral English. Knowledge of another European language/s is a plus;

 Well-developed presentation skills.

 Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and Microsoft Office programs.

 Demonstrated analytical abilities, with high attention to detail and focus on quality work.

 Ability to manage multiple projects and work in a team as well as independently in a dynamic environment with tight deadlines.

 Permission to work in the European Union and/or the UK. This position requires occasional travel within Europe.

 Team player with demonstrated ability to work in a fast-paced environment with team members across the globe.

 About Us

 DBRS Morningstar is a global credit ratings business, currently with 700 employees in eight offices globally. Formed through the July 2019 acquisition of DBRS by Morningstar, Inc., the ratings business is the fourth-largest provider of credit ratings in the world.

 DBRS Morningstar is committed to empowering investor success, serving the market through leading-edge technology and raising the bar for the industry. DBRS Morningstar is a market leader in Canada, the U.S. and Europe in multiple asset classes.

 DBRS Morningstar rates more than 2,600 issuers and 54,000 securities worldwide and is driven to bringing more clarity, diversity of opinion, and responsiveness to the ratings process. DBRS Morningstar’s approach and size provide the agility to respond to customers’ needs, while being large enough to provide the necessary expertise and resources.

Machine Learning Engineer/Computer Vision Scientist (Home Working) A skilled Computer Vision Scientist/Engineer to join a team of experienced technical personnel. This is an exciting opportunity to join a young technology company developing a new range of solutions that utilise deep learning techniques to solve real-world computer vision problems. Reporting to the Head of Machine Learning, you will be a technology driven individual with at least 1 years experience in using machine learning for commercial applications. fMachine Learning Engineers/Computer Vision Scientists will have some of the following experience; Knowledge of Computer Science fundamentals such as object-oriented design, algorithm design and evaluation, data structures, problem solving, and complexity analysis Bachelor’s degree or equivalent with a significant focus on computer vision (object detection & tracking; low light image enhancement; person re-identification; and video semantic understanding) or similar from a top-tier university. Experience using a range of Machine Learning Frameworks and conversions Experience using the Python programming language Demonstrable experience of evaluating and deploying DL solutions in an embedded environment for real-time execution Desired Skills/Experience; Masters in the area of Computer Science with a focus on ML/DL Experience of computer vision algorithm optimisation for embedded and GPU based Demonstrable interest in computer vision both in and out of the Use of version control software (SVN, GIT, ) The company operates an entirely remote working policy. The successful candidate would be expected to travel to a central London location on average 2 times per month for face to face company meetings (project planning, sprint, reviews). As a home worker, we would expect you to have an appropriate working environment and excellent internet access.

Job_title: Senior Applied Scientist - Traffic & Pricing Platform (w/d/m)
Description:
You will join the team responsible for Zalando's AI-fueled online marketing. Since Spring 2018 we grew from 20 to over 60 applied scientists, engineers and product managers to revamp our marketing with AI in a world of increasing user privacy.
 

 
As a 
 Senior Applied Scientist
  of the 
 Traffic Platform Applied Science
  team you will deliver effective and scientifically-sound solutions to our main business problems: estimating and optimizing the return on online marketing investment. Open-research problems are involved, at the intersection of econometrics, statistics, causal inference, reinforcement learning, giving opportunities for experimentation, creativity and scientific contributions.
 

 
We are looking for a data scientist with passion for Machine Learning or Econometrics, and able to consistently improve our solutions through proactive discovery and quality development. No one walks alone in our team, you will get all the support you need, and also you will be expected to support the team as well, in order to achieve results that we can all proudly celebrate.
 

 
This position is a unique opportunity to have visible impact, and connect with exceptional talents from many different backgrounds.
 

 
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED

 Problem Framing
 : Online marketing comes with complex and ambiguous challenges related to the main two questions -
 how to measure performance
  and 
 how to invest optimally- 
 under various constraints such as data privacy, Creativity and analytical thinking are among the most valuable skills in order to properly frame our problems and define relevant KPIs
 

 Problem Solving
 : Our challenges reward creativity combined with expertise from various domains, including time series forecasting, causal inference, online learning, statistics, econometrics
 Acting like an owner
 : Among Zalando's core values, one stands out for this job: 
 act like an owner
 . We are looking for talents eager to get things done and proactively push for milestone completion. Not necessarily quick and dirty, we prefer quick and clean by focusing on the core questions. You will get support from the team whenever needed, but we expect you to act like an owner.
 Make us better:
  We need your unique blend of skills to make our team more diverse and better. You will be encouraged to share your knowledge during projects, reading groups and coffee chats.
 

 WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR
 

 M.Sc (or higher) in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics, Physics)
 Real-World experience or academic background in Statistics and Machine Learning
 Experience in turning uncertainty and ambiguity into actionable roadmaps with specific milestones
 Customer-obsession: ability to integrate stakeholders needs into well-defined KPIs
 

 PERKS AT WORK
 

 Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs, product demos, parties & events
 Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
 Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
 Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations)
 

 We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.
 

 
Zalando SE
 

 
Zalando is Europe's leading online platform for fashion and lifestyle, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 35+ million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.
 

 
Please note that all the applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via e-mail.

Position:

 We are seeking an innovative, motivating Bioinformatician to join our Data Science team. This position will drive the development of computational tools and perform omics data analysis to support Mestag’s internal target identification and therapeutics development platforms. The successful candidate will work on closely with the biology teams in a range of disease indications including cancers and inflammatory/autoimmune diseases.
 

 

 It is anticipated that the bioinformatics function at Mestag will expand over time, and so the ability to think strategically about overall approaches, while also contributing to short term goals is considered essential. The level of appointment will be dependent on experience.
 

 

 Responsibilities:

 Drive novel computational approaches to translate human genetic and genomic evidence to inform target selection and validation decisions.
 Develop internal bioinformatic omics data analysis pipelines for data QC, processing and analysis. Maintenance of and improvements to existing genomic pipelines and bioinformatics tools will also be required.
 Develop and apply statistical methods and novel algorithms for integration of multi-omics datasets
 Support informatics components of functional screening platform, and viral vector characterisation
 Manage deployment of appropriate computational infrastructure

 Build in silico knowledgebase of critical targets, pathways, cell types and diseases, using system biology approaches.
 Engage with cross-functional project teams and external collaborators to support project planning and execution, provide expert advice and drive innovative use of genetic/genomic data and analyses.
 

 

 Qualifications / Criteria
 

 A PhD in Computational Biology, Data Science, Bioinformatics, Computer Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, Statistical Genetics, or a related discipline
 Demonstrated experience with high dimensional data and machine learning to integrate multi-omics data (e.g. transcriptomics, epigenomics, regulatory genomics, proteomics) for disease research.

 Specific experience with bulk and single cell RNA sequencing, ATAC-Seq and proteomics data would be essential, experience with spatial transcriptomics or immune repertoire analysis will be a plus.
 Proficiency in a programming language (such as R, Python, Perl, SQL) and a good working knowledge of common bioinformatics databases (e.g. ENCODE, GTEx, TCGA, Expression Atlas), resources and tools.

 Proficiency in various statistics methods, prediction models and machine learning algorithms, experience in deep learning is a plus.
 Experience with cloud computing (e.g. AWS) and automating pipelines (e.g. Snakemake/WDL/CWL).
 Experience working on target identification or biomarker/translational medicine, preferably in the context of drug discovery.

 Evidence of utilising informatics data in platform setting, interfacing with multiple internal company functions (e.g. Research/Discovery/Translational/Clinical Development, Functional screening, CMC)
 Sound understanding of statistics and biological concepts, coupled with data science skills to collect, integrate, mine and analyse complex biological data and translate them into testable hypotheses.

 Proven ability to engage constructively with colleagues internally at all levels across different departments as well as externally.

 Strong verbal and written communication skills to communicate complex concepts and computational analyses clearly to influence diverse audiences.
 

 Note to Agencies: We are not working with agencies on this role so please do not send us any speculative CVs.

Job_title: Senior Machine Learning Scientist - DeepTech Startup (AgriTech)
Description:
Are you excited by an opportunity to have a real impact on reducing the long-term environmental impact of modern agriculture? Do you have expertise in and a passion for Machine Learning and Computer Vision? Do you want to help reshape the future of farming by applying state-of-the-art AI-driven technology to solve some of the most challenging problems in agriculture? If so, then Hummingbird Technologies might have the perfect role for you.

 Hummingbird Technologies is an artificial intelligence SaaS platform using the latest deep learning and computer vision techniques to provide actionable intelligence to farmers and agri-businesses at key decision-making times in the growing season. We are not solving trivial problems, but researching and developing to shape the future of crop and farm management through the creation of AI-driven predictive analysis products. Our products are used across the globe to feed the world and minimise the long-term environmental impact of modern, large-scale agriculture and help us become a leader in carbon capture measurement in agriculture.

 
You will join a talented team of machine learning researchers, remote sensing scientists, computer vision experts, and software engineers. You will be expected to get up to speed rapidly in this fast-paced, multi-disciplinary environment. Your main responsibility will be to help develop machine learning algorithms to create cutting edge services for agriculture.

 

 Requirements:
 
Minimum Requirements

 MSc or Phd in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Remote Sensing, Statistics or a related field
 Strong expertise in deep learning for computer vision applications
 Broad knowledge of machine learning theory and time series analysis
 Track record of successfully delivering machine learning driven products in a production environment
 Experience with typical Machine Learning stack and tools: Python, Pandas, SciPy, scikit-learn, and one or more deep learning frameworks: TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras
 Experience writing production-grade code and using modern software development tools (version control, CI/CD, containers, etc.) in a cloud platform (GCP, AWS)
 
Ideal Additions

 Experience working with satellite and/or UAV imagery
 Experience with geospatial data processing and analysis tools like GDAL, QGIS, ArcGIS
 Shows interest in managing and leadership
 Educational or work exposure to agriculture, remote sensing, soil sciences or similar fields
 Experience working in a startup environment
 Experience working in agritech sector
 

 Benefits:
 

 Private Healthcare
 Government Pension scheme
 Flexible working
 Cycle to work scheme
 Discretionary bonus
 Learning & development allowance

Job_title: Associate Principal Biostatistician, Health Technology Assessment, Biostatistics and Research Decision Sciences (BARDS) (m/f/d)
Description:
The Biostatistics and Research Decision Sciences (BARDS) organization has a proud record of providing comprehensive analytical and methodological expertise to support our company’s strategic goals. Our quantitative scientists aspire to maintain the highest quality output while adopting the most efficient and effective scientific and operational procedures that will promote breakthrough innovation, collaboration and professional activity.
 The BARDS organization has established in Europe its Center of Excellence supporting Health Technology Assessment (HTA) dossiers, consisting of a global team of Statisticians and Statistical Programmers based across its Brussels (Belgium), London (UK) and Zurich (Switzerland) sites. Our statisticians and statistical programmers collaborate with multiple functional areas across the company and with our local affiliates to ensure that the clinical trial data representing our products is characterized properly in these dossiers, and to develop innovative statistical approaches to novel problems in the HTA space. 
 As the 
 Associate Principal Biostatistician (Associate Director level role)
  you will report to the Director of Biostatistics Health Technology Assessment based in London Kings Cross.
 Key responsibilities 
 Provide statistical leadership and support to projects in the BARDS HTA (Health Technology Assessment) Statistics group, including HTA submissions
 Interact with multidisciplinary scientists, company subsidiary project leads and Late Development Statisticians to support HTA submissions 
 Design, develop and evaluate tools and methods for HTA evaluations
 Give input to VEST (Value Evidence Sub Team) as a statistical representative and may contribute to VEST meetings
 Primary activities for the position:
 Lead and provide statistical support to the cross-functional teams preparing HTA submissions
 Plan and execute independently on the ongoing HTA evaluations, including analysis and interpretation of HTA results. Ensure that project deliverables meet analysis and submission requirements
 Collaborate with Statistical Programming lead to implement methodologies and ensure high quality deliverables for HTA submissions
 Lead the preparation of the written reports to effectively communicate results of HTA evaluations to the outcomes research and company affiliate teams
 Design, develop and apply HTA methods, processes and standard tools
 Provide response for queries from HTA agencies related to statistical analyses and methodological rationale 
 Evaluate appropriateness of available software for planned analyses and ascertains needs for potential program development of novel statistical methodology.
 Is involved in research activities for innovative statistical methods and applications in HTA activities
 May guide junior staff or contractors in functional activities within a project
 Education and Minimum Requirement:
  
 PhD or equivalent degree in Statistics/Biostatistics or a related discipline with a minimum of 3 years relevant work experience, Masters with a minimum of 6 years relevant work experience, or Bachelors with 10 years relevant experience
 Required Skills and Experience: 
 Good knowledge of biostatistical methodologies and experimental design, including meta-analyses and time to event methodologies. 
 Understanding of data management and clinical concepts applied to drug development within the pharmaceutical industry. 
 Working knowledge of statistical and data processing software e.g. SAS and/or R. Strong interest in statistical research activities and in application of novel methods to clinical development needs to be demonstrated. 
 Team oriented, strong collaboration skills and ability to work effectively across cultures. 
 Ability to learn, be proactive and motivated, and consistently focus on details and execution.
 Project management proficiency.
 Strong communication skills, ability to work with staff with different functional background.
 Preferred Skills and Experience: 
 Strong knowledge of computer systems and clinical database systems in a statistical environment.
 Experience or understanding of CDISC data standards (SDTM, ADAM)
 Understanding of biology of disease and drug development. 
 Publication record in peer reviewed statistical/medical journals
 Your role at our company is integral to helping the world meet new breakthroughs that affect generations to come, and we’re counting on your skills and inventiveness to help make meaningful contributions to global medical advancement. At our company, we’re inventing for life. 
 We are proud to be a company that embraces the value of bringing diverse, talented, and committed people together. The fastest way to breakthrough innovation is when diverse ideas come together in an inclusive environment. We encourage our colleagues to respectfully challenge one another’s thinking and approach problems collectively for the common good. We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace.

As a Senior Applied Scientist in the Market Insights team, you will tackle challenging fashion problems using state-of-the-art AI methods, exploring and using large amounts of multi-modal data. You will work with a group of exceptional scientists to develop algorithms and engineer cutting-edge machine learning and data science products that enhance the experience of our +37M customers and that support our fashion experts.
 

 
WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
 

 Bring in your strong scientific experience in researching and deploying machine learning and deep learning based solutions to help our millions of customers in their inspiration journey.
 Tackle challenging state-of-the-art fashion problems, such as competitor product matching against Zalando articles using Image or code based matching. Contribute to our scientific efforts with rigorous peer reviews and through publications in international conferences.
 Mentor junior and mid level applied scientists. Actively collaborate with other teams and share knowledge and expertise within our talented applied science community.
 Work closely with applied science leaders, product managers and other business stakeholders to bring our state of the art solutions to the customers and to discover and identify new opportunities.
 

 WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
 

 PhD or MSc (or comparative experience) in Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, or Physics, with at least 4 years of industry experience in Machine Learning/Data Science/Deep Learning.
 Experience building and leading complete ML products; from the problem analysis and data selection to their production deployment.
 Great coding skills in Python and hands-on experience with ML libraries such as sklearn, TensorFlow, or PyTorch, as well as experience with Cloud Computing frameworks (e.g., AWS).
 Deep understanding of the theory behind the state-of-the-art methods in your domain as well as a broad overview of Machine Learning and Deep Learning methods and best practices in their application
 

 PERKS AT WORK
 

 Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs, product demos, parties & events
 Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings

Your Role
 
The primary responsibility of the Sr. Research Analyst I is to develop relevant experience and knowledge under the mentoring and guidance of a Senior person to eventually be able to market himself/herself as an expert of a particular chemical product chain. Analysts act to support and develop the economic and other modelling capabilities on which the chemical industry expertise and insight offered by IHS Markit to clients is built. Analysts will have a client facing role, not only in addressing issues but increasingly to make presentations and discuss chemical chains. As such, they play an integral role in every aspect of the relationship with client companies. This can occasionally include resolving service accessibility issues, product support, and data requests.
 

 
General Job Duties:
 
Market products and services via direct and indirect client contact.
 
Perform presentations for clients both in our offices and onsite.
 
Market Report and Annual Analysis Responsibilities.
 
Maintain a detailed working knowledge of the basic databases and tools for responsible products, (Supply/Demand, Global Pricing System, Capacity Data Base and Trade Grids).
 
Econometrics - Maintenance and modifications for product specific models
 
Supply/Demand - Maintain, update, and balance long forms up through entire product chains, short forms and quarterlies as needed
 
CAPS - Maintain product capacities based on market intelligence
 
Actively pursue and develop unique analytical approaches that provide value to clients and/or potential clients.
 
Maintain and develop knowledge of state-of-the-art industry processes for specific product chain.
 
Involvement with long-term projects related to responsible products such as cost studies, etc
 
Specific Job Duties:
 

 
EOED, EMRA, NFFR, PFFR, Global Weekly Support
 
Write and proof text for Weekly and Monthly reports.
 
Ensure charts and price files are up to date for Global Weekly, NFFR, PFFR, EOED and EMRA.
 
Update Price/Supply/Demand/Forecast sections for reports
 
Update / create meaningful charts for reports
 
Answer European and Middle East industry and client questions about data and services.
 
Discover prices through industry contacts; maintain price forecasts both short and long term
 
Update Supply Demand Quarterly balances and Trade Reports
 
Ensure all Long Forms, Supply Demand Trade and Quarterly balances for the European Aromatics group are completed, accurate and up to date
 
Keep consultants informed of latest news or press releases related to their products
 
Help with client requests as needed
 
Assist in enabling accurate and timely publishing of all reports by maintaining accuracy of price and chart files and troubleshooting any publishing issues.
 

 
Annual World Analysis
 
Update trade grids
 
Match quarterly balances into the long forms before balancing begins
 
Help during the balancing process
 
Write sections for World Analysis as required
 
Update the Technology Economic snapshots
 
Create forecast trade grids for the book.
 
Maintain capacity and supply and demand data sources
 
Provide necessary support to consultants for Aromatics World Analyses as required
 
Answer or direct client questions relating to Aromatics World Analyses as required
 
Maintain trade charts
 
Maintain files and trade data for Aromatics products trade charts
 
Maintain logistics arbitrage analysis for specific Aromatics
 
Maintain logistic costs database
 
Consultant Support
 
Direct client website questions to relevant consultant
 
Proactively prepare and maintain economic and other models for use by consultants
 
Assist consultants in resolving model errors as required
 
Support consultants in development of client slides if required
 
About You
 
- Recent Graduates are welcome to apply -
 
Required Education:
 
Bachelor's Degree - Chemical Engineering, Chemistry or Technical Preferred
 
MBA a strong plus
 

 
Skills and Experience:
 
Previous work experience in a Petrochemicals company a significant advantage
 
Previous experience using analytical skills, ideally as a Business Analyst
 
Experience in customer facing roles an advantage
 
Chemical industry knowledge combined with a good level of product expertise.
 
Expertise with Microsoft Office products
 
A conceptual understanding of how economics and politics influence regional and global markets.
 
Proficient public speaker.
 
Ability to think through questions and/or problems and independently provide solutions.
 
Proactive and self-motivated, focused on delivery of quality results
 
Good team worker

IHS Markit maintains a substance-free workplace; employees may be asked to submit to a drug test (where permitted by law). In addition, as a federal contractor in the United States, the company participates in the E-Verify Program to confirm eligibility to work.
 
For information please click on the following links:
 
IHS Markit Business Code of Conduct
 
Right to Work
 
EEO is the Law
 
EEO is the Law Supplement
 
Pay Transparency
